moduleMetadataJson.name: OpenSSL Heartbeat (Heartbleed) Information Leak
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module implements the OpenSSL Heartbleed attack. The problem
        exists in the handling of heartbeat requests, where a fake length can
        be used to leak memory data in the response. Services that support
        STARTTLS may also be vulnerable.

        The module supports several actions, allowing for scanning, dumping of
        memory contents to loot, and private key recovery.

        The LEAK_COUNT option can be used to specify leaks per SCAN or DUMP.

        The repeat command can be used to make running the SCAN or DUMP many
        times more powerful. As in:
            repeat -t 60 run; sleep 2
        To run every two seconds for one minute.
author: Neel Mehta

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: VERBOSE
options.description: Enable detailed status messages

options.name: RHOSTS
options.description: The target host(s), range CIDR identifier, or hosts file with syntax 'file:<path>'

options.name: RPORT
options.description: The target port

options.name: SSL
options.description: Negotiate SSL/TLS for outgoing connections

options.name: SSLVersion
options.description: Specify the version of SSL/TLS to be used (Auto, TLS and SSL23 are auto-negotiate) (Accepted: Auto, TLS, SSL23, SSL3, TLS1, TLS1.1, TLS1.2)

options.name: SSLVerifyMode
options.description: SSL verification method (Accepted: CLIENT_ONCE, FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT, NONE, PEER)

options.name: SSLCipher
options.description: String for SSL cipher - "DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA" or "ADH"

options.name: Proxies
options.description: A proxy chain of format type:host:port[,type:host:port][...]

options.name: CPORT
options.description: The local client port

options.name: CHOST
options.description: The local client address

options.name: ConnectTimeout
options.description: Maximum number of seconds to establish a TCP connection

options.name: TCP::max_send_size
options.description: Maxiumum tcp segment size.  (0 = disable)

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: THREADS
options.description: The number of concurrent threads (max one per host)

options.name: ShowProgress
options.description: Display progress messages during a scan

options.name: ShowProgressPercent
options.description: The interval in percent that progress should be shown

options.name: TLS_CALLBACK
options.description: Protocol to use, "None" to use raw TLS sockets (Accepted: None, SMTP, IMAP, JABBER, POP3, FTP, POSTGRES)

options.name: TLS_VERSION
options.description: TLS/SSL version to use (Accepted: SSLv3, 1.0, 1.1, 1.2)

options.name: MAX_KEYTRIES
options.description: Max tries to dump key

options.name: STATUS_EVERY
options.description: How many retries until key dump status

options.name: DUMPFILTER
options.description: Pattern to filter leaked memory before storing

options.name: RESPONSE_TIMEOUT
options.description: Number of seconds to wait for a server response

options.name: LEAK_COUNT
options.description: Number of times to leak memory per SCAN or DUMP invocation

options.name: HEARTBEAT_LENGTH
options.description: Heartbeat length

options.name: XMPPDOMAIN
options.description: The XMPP Domain to use when Jabber is selected
